entry.title: Notes - Anne Wojcicki on How to Build the Future
entry.content:
***************************************************************************************
***************************************************************************************
File Name: Anne-Wojcicki-How-To-Build-Future-14042018
About: Notes from interview of Ms.Anne Wojcicki, founder of 23andme; with Mr.Sam Altman, President of Y Combinator.
Version 1: 14th April 2018
Link to Podcast: Anne Wojcicki on How to Build the Future
Author: Abhishek Rai
Date: 14th April 2018
Day: Saturday
***************************************************************************************
***************************************************************************************


1. "Incentives are superpowers" -  Charlie Munger 


2. Founder(s) should be wanting the solution they are building for others, personally. #key #criteria

3. Great companies are usually founded when founder(s) can see the intersection of two different trends, long before others can do so. #prediction #success

4. Health is both about GENES and ENVIRONMENT.  #random

5. People love vision and outline and founders need to outline them. #implement

6. When going through the proverbial "trough of sorrow", don't wallow on today but instead focus on what it could become in next few years to come. #implement



7. It is important to get feedback from customers in real time. #customer #success

8. Founders should be great at show-casing the value of their product and make sure that customers understand the proposition. #customers #success #implement

9.Hiring right talent is the key. #key

10. Humility is a key component of a right hire's character. A right hire would be open to criticism, feedback and learning from others. #key #hiring


11. Hiring wrong persons in leadership position, runs the risk of sinking the ship. #hiring

12. The guide to finding the smart people is find who love to questiona and argue the status quo. #key #hiring



13. Founder of a company operating in a regulated space would require a lot of (efficient) communicating to be done. #learn


14. Founders should learn the style, form and ways of communicating things (efficiently). #learn

15. The great opportunity for founders is to show-case the bigger picture to the regulators, as they love seeing that. #success #learn #implement


16. "Best companies are remarkably steadfast" - Sam Altman


17. Stick with your company/product. Persistence is the key. #learn #implement #key #success

18. It takes almost a decade to see the consequence of your actions (true for both good/bad). #key #success

19. Trust in compund growth and stick with it. Super consistency will help you beat many others in the long run. #implement


20. "Overnight success is ten years of persistence" - Anne Wojcicki

entry.title: About the EPL - Essential Podcast Lessons
entry.content:
Podcasts have become very popular in last years, reaching millions of listeners daily.

People listen to their favourite podcasts, while commuting, at office or at home; virtually at every concievable place.

While many podcasts have a transcript available to enable jotting down, important points and note taking; still it is a task figure out what is important and what is not.

Many a times, at the first listening, things are not obvious and it requires listening again, for better comprehension.

What if there is a site, where important lessons from top podacsts are listed; so that once you have finished listening to that podcasts, you can refer to this list and may decide to agree or dis-agree with it, copy it or ignore it, debate or just discard the opinions of the list author.

EPL or Essential Podcast Lessons is this one place.

Feel free to reach out to author and also comment on posts.
